result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Bacon

records.addlTxt: Signed at MCJ on 09/30/22
Posted on 09/30/22
PTC held; Future dates set;
Final pre-trial on November 8, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
PTC held; New Date Set;

Case Called: 9:02 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty John Wallace in person.
VRCW. 
Date and time set to address the Defendant's bond situation. 
Defendant had a Bond Forfeiture hearing previously set where bond was not forfeited, and a new bond was set in on this case in the interim. 
Parties make the record clear in regards to what bond the Defendant should be on. Court addresses the parties.

COURT ORDERS: 
$2,500 Signature Bond with First $250.00 Cash with the same Conditions is to be the Defendant's bond.

Adjourned: 9:05 am
Hearing on September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
$2500 signature bond with first $250 cash to remain current bond as clarified on 09/09/22
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Case Called: 10:15 a.m. 
Clerk Heather.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech; Defendant appears in person from MCJ, w/Attorney John Wallace;

ADA Lech requests the COURT to forfeit part of the bond due to multiple non-appearances.
Atty Wallace makes arguments. 
COURT vacates bond forfeiture at this time and reinstates previous bond with same conditions.

DATES:
PTC w/JA: 9/28/22 @ 2:00 p.m. 


Adjourned: 10:20 a.m.

$2500 Signature bond to be co-signed by 2 other adults with first $250 in cash. . No contact with victim(s): MAM or MAM's residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

$2500 Signature bond to be co-signed by 2 other adults with first $250 in cash. . No contact with victim(s): MAM or MAM's residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:08 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Greg Venturini. 
VRCW. 

**WARRANT QUASHED**

COURT ORDERS: $2500 signature bond to be co-signed by 2 other adults with first $250 in cash - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): MAM or MAM's residence. 

BRANCH 2 CASE. 
BFH: 9/2/2022 at 10:00 am.
$157.55 warrant fee. Being brought to jail from Marinette County.

Case called: 2:50 p.m. 
Clerk: Heather.  
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant FAILS to appear, w/Attorney John Wallace in person.

Atty Wallace indicates he has had contact with his client.
ADA Barnett requests a bench warrant and a bond forfeiture hearing.
COURT authorizes BW $2,500.00 cash. 

DATES:
BH: 9/2/22 @ 10:00 a.m. 

Adjourned: 2:52 p.m.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing on August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 9:31 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett in person. Defendant FAILS to appear, with Atty John Wallace appearing in person.
VRCW.

ADA Barnett requests BW and bond forfeiture.
Atty Wallace indicates his client is broke down on the side of the road.
ADA Barnett will rescind request for BW so Defendant can appear.

DATES:
PH: 8/16/22 @ 2:30 p.m. 

Adjourned: 9:34 a.m.
